description: Tourism in North India is a delightful experience to cherish for lifetime. There are numerous places and fascinating tourist destinations to see and explore in this region that will never fail to lure you. Delhi, the national capital of India, lies in this region. The region presents varied tourism options such as cultural & heritage tourism, wildlife tourism, nature tourism, hill station tourism, adventure tourism, rural tourism, medical tourism and heritage tourism.
details: Red Fort, Qutub Minar & Humayun’s Tomb – UNESCO World Heritage Sites
Old Fort, India Gate War Memorial, President House & Parliament House
Lotus Temple, Birla Temple & Jama Masjid – India’s largest mosque
Rajghat – the cremation site of Mahatma Gandhi
Boat ride on the River Ganges, India’s most sacred river
Buland Darwaza – the largest gateway in the world
